title: Top 10 Best Waste Management Companies In Europe 2023 - Inventiva
summary: The article discusses the importance of waste management in modern society, emphasizing its role in public health, environmental protection, resource conservation, energy generation, and economic benefits. It highlights several leading waste management companies in Europe, such as Veolia, SUEZ, Renewi, Biffa, FCC Environment, EcoLogic, Ragn-Sells, Remondis, Ros Roca, and Amey, that are committed to sustainability and innovation. Each company employs various technologies to treat waste, recycle materials, generate energy, and minimize environmental impacts.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article describes waste management practices and companies that implement sustainable technologies and processes aimed at reducing environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE - The companies mentioned offer new or improved waste management services and technologies that differ significantly from prior offerings, thereby representing business innovations.
green_product: FALSE - While the companies provide services that entail waste management and recycling, no specific product that meets the comprehensive definition of a green product is explicitly mentioned.
green_process: TRUE - The article discusses various sustainable waste management processes employed by the companies, such as recycling, energy recovery, and resource recovery, all aimed at minimizing environmental impact.
company: Veolia, SUEZ, Renewi, Biffa, FCC Environment, EcoLogic, Ragn-Sells, Remondis, Ros Roca, Amey
official_company_name: Company names already provided: Veolia, SUEZ, Renewi, Biffa, FCC Environment, EcoLogic, Ragn-Sells, Remondis, Ros Roca, Amey
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562211 - Collection of Nonhazardous Waste, 562213 - Collection of Hazardous Waste, 922790 - Other Justice, Public Order, and Safety Activities
greenwashing: FALSE - The article provides detailed information on the companies' commitment to sustainability and the technologies they use, which suggests a genuine focus on reducing environmental impact rather than misleading claims.
